antgame.core

Class Match

  • java.lang.Object
    • antgame.core.Match

  • public class Match
extends java.lang.Object
    A match between two supplied players. Once constructed call run(int, int), which iterates continually until the match is complete. Then the outcome of the match can be obtained using outcome().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Match

        public Match(Player playerRed,
             Player playerBlack,
             World world)
        Creates a new Match using the supplied players and world
        Parameters:
        playerRed - The player who's brain will control the red colony
        playerBlack - The player who's brain will control the black colony
        world - The parsed or generated world the match will be played in

    • Method Detail

      • redPlayer

        public Player redPlayer()
        Returns:
        the player that has the red colony in this match

      • blackPlayer

        public Player blackPlayer()
        Returns:
        the player that has the black colony in this match

      • run

        public void run(int rounds,
                int speed)
        Runs the match determining and returning the winner based on which colony has more food in their ant hills
        Parameters:
        rounds - The number of rounds to run the match for (Usually NUM_ROUNDS at 300000)
        speed - the speed to run the match - from 1 to 100 (or more to not pause between steps at all)

      • redStatistics

        public ColonyStatisticsTracker redStatistics()
        Returns:
        current match statistics for the red player

      • blackStatistics

        public ColonyStatisticsTracker blackStatistics()
        Returns:
        current match statistics for the black player

      • finished

        public boolean finished()
        Checks if the match has finished or not.
        Returns:
        True if the match is finished, false otherwise.

      • outcome

        public MatchOutcome outcome()
        Gets the outcome of the match.
        Returns:
        The MatchOutcome produced at the end of the match

      • world

        public World world()
        Gets the match's World.
        Returns:
        The world this match takes place in
